questionTitle: The little girl wouldn't go into the sea ________ her father went too.
The ________ part of the week is always busy for me.
She ________ to take her neighbour to court if he didn't stop making so much noise.
You mustn't be angry with her. It wasn't her ________ that she was late.
He sat there with his arms ________ doing nothing, waiting for us.
Our neighbours ________ their hedge cut once a year.
I could tell he was pleased ________ the expression on his face.
Tom always calls himself Tom Williams, but his ________ surname is Winterbottom.
If you keep trying you might ________ to do it.
Joan's third child was born in the ambulance ________ to the hospital.
The meeting, ladies and gentlemen, is now ________.
They promised to write ________ we never heard from them again.
I ________ to him for my bad behaviour.
Ever ________ he was in junior school Nicholas has wanted to become a doctor.
It was on the top shelf, out of ________.
Computers are supposed to ________ time, but I'm not so sure they do!
I didn't mean to do it; it was ________ accident.
Her acceptance speech was ________, eliciting thunderous applause at several points.
a wild goose chase = ________.
anwers: a wild night on the town
a dangerous race in the streets between cars trying to
a search for something that cannot be found

questionTitle: You could have avoided risking ________, General Brown.
